info.description: Retrieves forex limit orders of customers
info.title: API to perform different actions on foreign exchange limit orders

get.summary: Retrieves forex orders created for customers to buy/sell currencies at desired rates
get.description: Retrieves forex orders created for the given customer to buy/sell currencies at desired rates and specified dates along with the order status(active,cancelled etc.)

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Identifier of the customer

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

put.summary: Cancels an existing forex limit order
put.description: Cancels an existing forex limit order of a customer

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

post.summary: Creates forex limit order for a customer
post.description: Creates forex limit order for a customer and also displays the list of existing limit orders

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

get.summary: Retrieves the forex deals created out of the forex limit order of the given customer
get.description: Retrieves the forex deals created out of the forex limit order to buy/sell currencies at customer specified rates

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Identifier of the customer

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

get.description: Retrieves the open position for different currencies

parameters.name: currencyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the currency. This is the 3-letter ISO 4217 code of the currency.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: body Payload

parameters.name: validate_only
parameters.description: The identifier to indicate if it is set to only validate or not.

get.summary: Retrieves all the foreign exchange active deals as on today
get.description: Retrieves the foreign exchange outstanding(active) deals as on today

parameters.name: dealType
parameters.description: Foreign Exchange deal type. Allowed values: - SP(spot) - FW(forward) - SW(Swap)

parameters.name: counterparty
parameters.description: The counterparty ID  for the  deal.

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: Unique transaction identifier for retrieving the details of the transaction. For example: FT0102030333 etc.

parameters.name: swapId
parameters.description: Swap contract identifier

parameters.name: settlementDateSell
parameters.description: Settlement date for sell side.

parameters.name: settlementDateBuy
parameters.description: Settlement date for buy side.

parameters.name: buyCurrency
parameters.description: ISO Currency code for the bought currency.

parameters.name: buyAmount
parameters.description: Amount bought in the FX deal.

parameters.name: sellCurrency
parameters.description: ISO Currency code for the sold currency.

parameters.name: sellAmount
parameters.description: Amount sold in the FX deal.

parameters.name: dealDate
parameters.description: Date on which the deal was agreed.

parameters.name: unevenSwap
parameters.description: Identifier for a FX uneven swap  (the swap base currency amount in near and far leg are not the same).

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

page_size.description: The total number of records per page

page_start.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

total_size.description: The total number of records present

page_token.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request

dealDate.description: Date on which the deal was agreed.

orderCurrency.description: Currency to be bought or sold through the limit  order.

contraCurrency.description: Opposite to order currency. Currency of the amount paid or received against order amount bought/sold.

contraAmount.description: Opposite to order amount. Amount paid or received against order amount bought/sold.

buyOrSell.description: Whether the transaction is a buy or a sell.

exchangeRate.description: Contains the exchange rate returned from the system. i.e. For entries over foreign currency accounts, this contains the rate which used to convert the currency amount to the local equivalent at the time of the originating transaction.

orderRateLow.description: The low rate stipulated for order execution.

orderRateHI.description: The high rate stipulated for order execution.

T24_time.description: Time taken to response by T24

requestParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the request by IRIS

responseParse_time.description: Time taken to parse the response by IRIS

type.description: The identifier of error type: Business

buyOrSells.description: Whether the transaction is a buy or a sell.

buyOrSell.description: Whether the transaction is a buy or a sell.

orderItemType.description: Purpose of the order i.e. stop loss , take profit or one cancels the other.

orderRateLow.description: The low rate stipulated for order execution.

orderRateHI.description: The high rate stipulated for order execution.

dealType.description: Foreign Exchange deal type. Allowed values: - SP(spot) - FW(forward) - SW(Swap)

dealerDesk.description: The dealer/desk responsible for monitoring and managing the currency positions.

orderCurrency.description: Currency to be bought or sold through the limit  order.

contraCurrency.description: Opposite to order currency. Currency of the amount paid or received against order amount bought/sold.

valueDate.description: Indicates the value date on which the underlying accounting entry is to be given value (for interest purposes)

expiryDate.description: The date an agreement such as an arrangement, product, credit facility or limit is due to expire

expiryTime.description: The time when the order expires.

goodTillCancel.description: The  order does not expire until it is cancelled.

orderType.description: Identifies the type of the order. Possible values are Single, Ifdone, Revol, oco. Single order - only one order item may be input. If done order -  If one order gets executed, the other order is also executed immediately. Revolving order -  based on the condition specified, it will wait for both the deals to be executed simultaneously. OCO -If one order gets executed, then the other order gets cancelled.

receiveAccount.description: The account used for payment received.

payAccount.description: The account used for payment made.

goodTillCancel.description: The  order does not expire until it is cancelled.

orderType.description: Identifies the type of the order. Possible values are Single, Ifdone, Revol, oco. Single order - only one order item may be input. If done order -  If one order gets executed, the other order is also executed immediately. Revolving order -  based on the condition specified, it will wait for both the deals to be executed simultaneously. OCO -If one order gets executed, then the other order gets cancelled.

forwardPosition.description: Currency position with value date greater than spot.
